ThingDef.label: golden eye
ThingDef.description: Replaces missing eyes. So incredibly beautiful that it's a shame you can't see yourself in the mirror.

ThingDef.label: artificial nose
ThingDef.description: Replaces a missing nose. Covers the hole in the face.

ThingDef.label: cochlear implant
ThingDef.description: An implant which replaces normal hearing. An external microphone transmits a sound signal to electrodes wrapped around the inner ear's auditory sensing nerves. The electrodes stimulate the nerves according to the sound, creating a sensation of hearing. It's not as good as a natural ear, but it's a lot better than being deaf.

ThingDef.label: hydraulic jaw
ThingDef.description: Replaces a missing jaw. Be careful with the extremely efficient teeth!

ThingDef.label: light receptor
ThingDef.description: Replaces a missing eye. Can detect light and even objects. Like looking through frosted glass but without the colors.

ThingDef.label: simple prosthetic hand
ThingDef.description: Replaces missing hands. Way more comfortable and less frightening than the hook hand.

ThingDef.label: simple prosthetic foot
ThingDef.description: Replaces missing feet. Not as cheap as a wood log.

ThingDef.label: simple prosthetic leg
ThingDef.description: Simple prosthesis made to replace a missing leg. Not very comfortable but quite efficient.

ThingDef.label: artificial pelvis
ThingDef.description: Replaces a missing pelvis. Pretty useful if crawling is not your favourite way of moving around.

ThingDef.label: artificial clavicle
ThingDef.description: Replaces a missing clavicle. If you somehow manage to break yours.
